text.p: Here are highlights of stories reported by Hungary's press, based on information by Nepszabadsag's Hungary Around the Clock service. For further details on how to subscribe to Hungary Around the Clock, please contact Monica Kovacs at (361) 351 7142 or fax your request to (361) 351 7141.
***GENERAL***
ALL PAPERS
- Socialist MP Imre Simon will give up his parliamentary seat after a screening showed he was an agent of the communist secret police in the 70s.
- Socialist MP Gabor Kiss Gellert would prefer individual Holocaust compensation for gypsies as against their claim for collective compensation.
- The electoral bill draft would restrict campaign spending to one million forints per candidate.
- The communist Workers' Party and the Humanist movement staged a demonstration against the possible deployment of nuclear missiles in Hungary.
- German Construction Minister Klaus Topfer said Germany should terminate contracts of east Europeans working mainly in the building industry.
VILAGGAZDASAG
- Ruling Socialists lead in a recent opinion poll with opposition Young Democrats following them with a two percent gap.
***BUSINESS***
ALL PAPERS
- June average gross wages were up 22 percent from the same period of 1996.
- Hungary's sugar beet crop is expected to drop to 3.8 million tonnes from last year's 4.6 million.
MAGYAR HIRLAP
- The jobless rate in June was 10.5 percent, up 0.2 percent from May.
NAPI GAZDASAG
- Hungarian electricity works MVM posted a 13 billion forints loss last year.
- Dresdner Kleinwort Benson projected a five percent GDP growth for Hungary next year.
